entry.title: SAC: Issue with data load, error 1016
entry.content:
Hello 

we have multiple loading jobs failing in SAP Analytics Cloud from SAP BW sources with the error:

Data preparation ended unexpectedly. Error code: 1016

Correlation ID: 3A510850-1FCA-492D-a180-F00654E4A58624

 All of them are updating acquired models.  

Does anyone else face the same issue?

thank you

entry.title: How to Dynamically Restrict Data Display for Incomplete Current Month in SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC)?
entry.content:
Requirement Details:

  • If the current month is June 2025 and the data is still in progress (incomplete), users should only see data up to May 2025.

  • If users try to select June 2025 from an input control (dropdown filter, for example), no data should be displayed for that selection.

Constraints:

  • The logic should be dynamic – it should automatically handle month transitions.

  • We do not want to rely on manual filter updates every month.

  • Tried options like:

    • Using input control filters based on date dimensions

    • Restricted measures with calculated filters

    • Custom calculations to compare with current date

But these methods either expose the current month partially or require manual intervention.

Question:

How can we dynamically restrict or hide data for the incomplete current month in SAC stories, based on real-time logic — possibly using scripting, calculated dimensions, or model-based conditions?

Is there a way to:

  • Use a dynamic flag for “month completion” that updates automatically?

  • Apply this restriction globally in the story without editing every chart?

  • Possibly handle this via model-level logic or a system variable?

entry.title: In SAP Learning Hub, is BDC, SAC, Datasphere, S/4HANA, or BW/4HANA available?
entry.content:
I know that there's a trial version of BDC, and it appears to have the following components.

SAC
Datasphere
SAP Databricks
S/4HANA Private Edition 

However, they appear to be restricted.

In the SAP Learning Hub, would any of these be available on?

SAC
Datasphere
SAP Databricks
S/4HANA Private Edition 
BW/4HANA Private Edition

If not, how do I make a recommendation to add it to the SAP Learning Hub?

Thanks!

Regards,

Mel Calucin

which is downloading with "comma" delimiter. Can you please help how can I download with a Pipe delimiter

 

Thanks and Regards,

Venkat

entry.title: SAP Analytics Cloud copy of production tenant into test tenant
entry.content:
Hello,

is there any solution to create a system copy of the production tenant and import this in the test tenant?

We need this for some test scenarios cause of a BW upgrade.. The integrated export solution is propably not the right solution to do this. We getting failures (maybe the size or the number of stories, etc. too high).

Maybe there is a way to backup the prod tenant and restore it to the test tenant? Maybe just the support could do this?

Is there any way to proceed this?

Thank you!

Timo

entry.title: Creating two input controls on single dimension

entry.title: How to keep a dimension up to date without reloading the entire data history
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I have an import model in SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) that includes several public dimensions, such as “Customer” and “Vendor.” The model contains about 15 years of data, with approximately 2 million rows per year. Due to the volume and duration of the data load, we only reload the last 2 years, every day

The Data Source is a BW Query. "Vendor" and "Customer" are Public Dimensions.

“Vendor” is an attribute of “Customer” (i.e., “Customer.Vendor”), and as an attribute, it updates automatically. However, we need “Vendor” as a separate dimension for two main reasons: we apply Data Access Control on it, and it contains additional attributes like "zip code", "street" or "phone number".

 

The main issue is that we need a way to keep the “Vendor” dimension current across all records, including historical ones, without reloading all the transactional data. Ideally, we would like to manage this through Master Data updates, but SAC doesn’t seem to support dimension-only updates without a full reload of the underlying transactional data.

Although our specific case involves “Customer” and “Vendor,” the question is more general: is there any way to maintain and update dimensions (not just attributes) in SAC via Master Data, without having to reload the entire transactional model?

Thank you very much in advance,

Jesús

entry.title: IMPLEMENTACIÓN SAC con SAP Business One 10 HANA
entry.content:
Estimados,

Nos encontramos evaluando los requisitos técnicos para implementar SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) en conjunto con nuestro entorno de pruebas de SAP Business One versión HANA, el cual se encuentra en modalidad on-premise.

Sabemos que existen dos métodos posibles de conexión desde SAC hacia SAP HANA:

  1. Conexión directa (Live Connection)

  2. Conexión a través de SAP Cloud Connector

En este contexto, nos surgen algunas dudas que agradeceríamos puedan ayudarnos a aclarar:

  • ¿Ambos tipos de conexión requieren licencias específicas adicionales?

  • ¿Es necesario instalar componentes adicionales en el servidor SAP HANA o en otro equipo?

  • En el caso de utilizar SAP Cloud Connector, ¿qué tipo de servidor o especificaciones mínimas se recomiendan para su instalación? ¿Es necesario que sea un servidor robusto?

Agradeceríamos cualquier documentación, experiencia o recomendaciones que nos permitan avanzar de forma correcta con esta implementación.

Desde ya, muchas gracias por su colaboración.

Saludos cordiales,

entry.title: Resource Purchase & Consumption IFP Product Costing
entry.content:
Dear All,

Could anyone assist with how we should plan the purchases of raw material resources using the standard product cost content in IFP?

We aim to calculate:
Opening Stock + Purchases – Consumption  = Inventory.

While consumption is easy to derive, determining the required purchases is unclear. Additionally, is there a way in IFP to display the breakdown of change—i.e., show purchases and consumption separately instead of a net change? If so, how can this be achieved? need to show the balances interms of Quantity 

Looking forward to your guidance.

SAP Datasphere SAP Analytics Cloud

entry.title: How to Use an Attribute from One Model to Populate a Dimension in Another Model via Data Action (SAC
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I’m working with two planning models in SAP Analytics Cloud: Model A (FIN_COSTPLANNING) contains the dimension CostCenter, which has an attribute called DepartmentGroup_Assignment. Model B (HR_RESOURCEPLANNING) includes both CostCenter and DepartmentGroup as separate dimensions.

My goal is to create a Data Action in Model B that uses the CostCenter as a link to bring in the corresponding DepartmentGroup (originally stored as an attribute in Model A) and write it into the DepartmentGroup dimension in Model B.

Since attributes cannot be directly referenced in advanced formulas, I’m unsure how to best implement this logic across models. 

What is the recommended solution to achieve this?

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: Can SAC work like power pivot from Excel?
entry.content:
Gurus,

  I came across this very basic issue in SAC just trying things around: Table A has customer ID and sales, Table B has customer ID and customer region. I just wanted to make a graph of sales by region by linking dimension customer ID in the 2 tables. However after linking i could not make the graph because SAC gave me this error message: 'For the ewidget to render, you need to add a linked dimension between the primary model and the secondary model.'

  The whole point of linking dimension to me is to do power pivoting similar to that in Excel. If i have to add the linked dimension there is no point of making the graph. What am I missing here? Thank you!

entry.title: Performance improvements in SAC Story Building
entry.content:
🚀 Speed vs. Features in SAP SAC?

Some features in SAP Analytics Cloud make stories "shine" ✨—others just slow them down 🐢.  I’ve seen both, and it made me wonder…

In our SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) stories, we wanted to automatically set the date input to the previous month when the story opens. Since SAC doesn’t support customer exit variables like in traditional SAP BW reports, we solved it using a script in the onInitialization event.

This script runs as soon as the story opens and sets the input control to the previous month based on the current date.

Here's the script with step-by-step comments:

// Get the current date and time
var cur_date = new Date(Date.now());

// Extract the current year and month
var jahr = cur_date.getFullYear();  // e.g., 2025
var monat = cur_date.getMonth();    // January = 0, December = 11

// If the current month is January (0), go to December of the previous year
if (monat === 0) {
    monat = 12;
    jahr = jahr - 1;
}

// Create a CalendarDateTime object for the previous month
// Note: month must be 1-based (January = 1, not 0 as cur_date.getMonth() hands it over)
var calenderYearCCD = CurrentDateTime.createCalendarDateTime({
    granularity: CalendarTimeGranularity.Month,
    year: jahr,
    month: monat
});

// Set the application's current date/time filter to the calculated month
Application.setCurrentDateTime(calenderYearCCD);

Current Date Input Control for dynamic date range setting of all widgets:

 

🛠️ What We Tested to Improve Performance

To support our dynamic date script and reduce load times, we experimented with several SAC story features to see how they affect performance:

  • 🔁 Widget Data Refresh Options – e.g. refresh active widgets only

  • 👁️ Initial Widget Visibility – showing all widgets by sizing them accordingly

This script is used in onActive, the Panels are set to 1/10 the size they should be, so the user sees all widgets on the story when she opens the story. This had a huge impact on loading times. because otherwise as soon as she starts scrolling, the widgets that have not been loaded yet start loading which weirdly can take even more time then loading everything together.

var AllShrinkPanels = [Panel_64, Panel_78, Panel_67, Panel_79, Panel_80, Panel_81, Panel_82, Panel_83, Panel_84, Panel_85, Panel_86, Panel_87];


for (var w = 0;w<AllShrinkPanels.length;w++){
	AllShrinkPanels[w].getLayout().setWidth(AllShrinkPanels[w].getLayout().getWidth().numberValue * 10);

  • 🔗 Linked Dimensions – Astonishingly this alone was not an issue

  • 🧭 Filters Across Linked Models – As long as all filters are created based on the same model, there was no serious performance issue (but using dimensions from another model was.

  • ➕ Sums in Tables – huge impact on loading times

  • 🎨 Conditional Formatting – looks great, marginally hurts performance

  • 🔄 Linked Analysis Across Models – convenient but can be a bottleneck, if key dimension is not included in other model so it has to join twice to get a result.

⚠️ Disclaimer: Our tests were done using fairly large datasets, so the performance impact may vary with smaller or simpler data models.

💬 What’s your take?

Which SAC features help or hurt performance in your experience? Let’s share tips and horror stories.👇

entry.title: SAC Live Connection to CDS Entity
entry.content:
Has anyone tried using a CDS Entity as a source to a SAC story using a Live connection?

The earlier definition of 'define view' with '@Analytics: { query: true }' annotation works fine. I am able to browse and find the 2C<sqlViewName> in SAC.

But when I use the 'define view entity' with '@Analytics: { query: true }' annotation, I am able to see the 2C<CDSviewName> in RSRT, but it does not show up in SAC.

I couldn't find much information on CDS entity as a source to SAC. Has anyone tried using CDS entity in SAC?
